definition: to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns

sentences.english: Hargett sank the ball with his brother’s 9 iron to win the prize.
sentences.chinese: 哈盖特用他兄弟的球杆挥杆进洞赢得了奖金。

sentences.english: Fast-swing players make up the majority of the avid golf population.
sentences.chinese: 挥杆速度偏快的球友已形成为数众多的高尔夫人口。

sentences.english: He also bends a shrub with his hand, improving the area of his intended swing.
sentences.chinese: 他还用手折弯了一个矮树，改善了意欲挥杆的区域。

sentences.english: They have the same groomed swing that they repeat time and time again.
sentences.chinese: 他们一遍一遍地重复著整齐划一的挥杆方式。

sentences.english: It uses the touch-screen for the swing mechanic in a way that feels natural.
sentences.chinese: 它用触摸屏来进行挥杆，感觉很自然。

sentences.english: The shaft of a players club broke during his downswing.
sentences.chinese: 一名球员球杆的杆身在下挥杆的时候折断了。

sentences.english: He took out a club with a very big head, stood, swang and shot.
sentences.chinese: 他拿出一个头很大的杆子，站好，挥杆，打。

sentences.english: Ok, so I would recommend getting a little bit more width on the backswing.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我建议在上杆的时候，要增加一些挥杆的宽度。

sentences.english: You need to work on your golf swing.
sentences.chinese: 你应该要好好练练你的高尔夫挥杆动作。

definition: club (golf)/cue (billiards)/also written 球桿|球杆[qiu2 gan1]
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
